event.title: settled by the Lynde family in 1753

data.event: Originally known as "Lyndeborough Addition", the area was first settled by the Lynde family in 1753.

event.title: 1953, the Crotched Mountain Rehabilitation Center began

data.event: In 1953, the Crotched Mountain Rehabilitation Center began operation in Greenfield.
The complex today provides service to over 2,000 children and adults.
In 2004, it unveiled the first wheelchair-accessible treehouse in New Hampshire.

event.title: 2008, although there are unofficial reports of 2,000-to-2,300-foot (610 to 700 m) throws

data.event: The farthest official toss is 1,897 feet (578 m) as of 2008, although there are unofficial reports of 2,000-to-2,300-foot (610 to 700 m) throws as of 2009.
